channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sam Altman’s Start-Up Launches Eye-Scanning Crypto Orbs in the U.S.
item.description: World, a start-up backed by Sam Altman, has launched in the United States with the goal of verifying your humanity.

item.title: Trump’s Tariff on Cheap Chinese Imports Will Cost Big Tech Billions
item.description: For Meta, Alphabet and other platforms, the elimination of the tariff exemption for inexpensive goods is already cutting into advertising revenue.

item.title: Ghana Wanted a Cathedral. It Got an ‘Expensive Hole’ Instead.
item.description: The nation had grand plans for a national cathedral designed by a celebrity architect. The $400 million project became a political battleground.

item.title: 2 Planes Abort Landings as Army Helicopter Flies Near D.C. Airport
item.description: The episode followed a fatal collision between a military helicopter and a commercial jet in January, and prompted concern and outrage among officials...

item.title: Nio is facing heavy competition in China’s fierce EV market. Making key design decisions ‘within hours’ could help it break through
item.description: To keep ahead of the competition, “design really has to be leading edge, always looking forward, very progressive," says Kris Tomasson, Nio's VP of de...

item.title: Car Prices Expected to Rise as Tariffs on Parts Kick In
item.description: Tariffs on imported parts will have a broad impact because all vehicles use components made abroad.

item.title: In Singapore’s Election, All Eyes Are on the Margin of Victory, Not the Winner
item.description: The People’s Action Party is widely expected to continue its six-decade reign. But discontent with its policies is fueling a growing opposition.

item.title: Australia Election 2025: Voters Focus on Cost-of-Living Concerns Amid Global Turmoil
item.description: Voters will decide who can turn Australia around from the throes of inflation and a housing crisis, and navigate relations with a volatile Washington.

item.title: Ghana Wanted a Cathedral. It Got an ‘Expensive Hole’ Instead.
item.description: The nation had grand plans for a national cathedral designed by a celebrity architect. The $400 million project became a political battleground.

item.title: How Trump Dismantled His First-Term Policy on Crimea
item.description: After more than three years of war, President Trump proposed a peace plan for Russia and Ukraine in late April that would have the United States recog...

item.title: Message From the Russian Military: ‘We Lost Your Son’
item.description: Russia lacks any formal, organized effort to account for legions of missing soldiers. That often leaves relatives in limbo, fending for themselves wit...

item.title: Exclusive: TikTok bidder calls $600 million EU fine latest example in ‘avalanche of evidence’ social media companies control too much user data
item.description: An Irish regulator fined TikTok for breaching laws meant to safeguard users’ personal information.

item.title: In Wall Street’s epic comeback, unsolved market mysteries abound
item.description: The financial ecosystem is flashing warning signs for the likes of hedge funds and day traders plunging back into risk.

item.title: United to cut Newark operations as FAA issues snarl flights
item.description: The “long-simmering FAA challenges boiled over this week,” United Chief Executive Officer Scott Kirby said in a letter to customers Friday.

item.title: Berkshire’s board doesn’t see Buffett’s successor ‘as a CEO in waiting,’ lead director says. ‘He’s taking on the leadership capacity right now’
item.description: The company hosts its annual shareholder meeting this weekend highlighted by a Q&A with CEO Warren Buffett on Saturday.
